item.title: TonRunner
item.description:
TonRunner

This is my scrapbook of all things that interest, amuse, fascinate and inspire me in the world of swimming, cycling and running. I could have done it on facebook but all my friends and family are probably sick to death of my constant witterings and ramblings.

item.title: [Run Tip#2]
item.description:
[Run Tip#2]

Five 'big' steps to make you a better runner; nobody said it was going to be easy, but if you if you can go some way to achieve these steps you become a stronger runner and running will become more enjoyable. As with every change start with little steps and grow into the habit.

item.title: How you can join in the fun at this year's Tunbridge Wells Half Marathon
item.description:
How you can join in the fun at this year's Tunbridge Wells Half Marathon

Excitement is building ahead of this year's annual Tunbridge Wells Half Marathon - and organisers are promising a great day for the whole community. The 33rd race will take over the town on Sunday, February 21 setting off at 9am near the Fusion Lifestyle sports centre on St John's Road.

item.title: 11 Weeks to Brighton
item.description:
11 Weeks to Brighton 

10 weeks to Brighton      

One of the many things I have learned about running and in particular training,  over the last five years is that you can only succeed if you have a goal. If you don't have a goal there is no incentive to train 'hard'. I use the term 'hard' because I actually enjoy running and would more than happily just go for a jog in the countryside, but that is not training. What I mean is having the discipline to go out when the weather is lashing it down, pushing yourself for that last 2miles of a threshold run when it would be so easy to pack it in early, after all who is ever going to know?

item.title: 'Lazy' Dog Crashes Half Marathon, Finishes Seventh
item.description:
'Lazy' Dog Crashes Half Marathon, Finishes Seventh

What started as a typical half-marathon ended as anything but when a hound dog joined the race and snagged a seventh-place finish. According to Runner's World, the 2-and-a-half-year-old hound dog named Ludivine slipped away from her backyard the morning of Jan.

item.title: The 25 Golden Rules of Running
item.description:
The 25 Golden Rules of Running

The most effective training mimics the event for which you're training. This is the cardinal rule of training for any activity. If you want to run a 10-K at seven-minute-per-mile pace, you need to do some running at that pace.
